xwikidoc.name: ccmArchive20140317
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 17 March 2014
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 01:17 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 08:23 <winter_flower> has joined #ccm 10:46 <ruthgrace_> has joined #ccm 10:50 <ruthgrace_> Hello. I am a 4th year student at the University of Western Ontario, studying for a Bachelor of Medical Science, in the Honors Spec Computational Biochemistry module. I am interested in applying for Google Summer of Code. 10:51 <ruthgrace_> The two projects that I think I would be most suited for are the MedSavant pathway analysis app and the project to extend Phenotips to use ICD-10 ontology 10:51 <ruthgrace_> Do you already have students in mind for this project? 10:52 <ruthgrace_> Or the MedSavant one? 10:52 <ruthgrace_> Thanks in advance. 10:58 <ruthgrace_> I will email Asha about the MedSavant pathway analysis project. Thank you. 11:36 <s37syed> has joined #ccm 11:36 <s37syed> hello everyone! 11:40 <s37syed> I had a question in regards to developing the MedSavant BigData back end. I have lots of experience with some DB, only read up on MapReduce. I definitely have experience with some Data Mining techniques, and would like to apply. Would I still be eligble even though I don't have any formal experience with Hadoop MapReduce? 11:41 <s37syed> I know there's only four days left as well, and my submission will probably be really last minute, unfortunately education does have its flaws. =P 12:08 <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 12:09 <sdumitriu> Hi ruthgrace_ 12:09 <ruthgrace_> hello 12:10 <sdumitriu> Both projects are still open 12:10 <ruthgrace_> Thank you. I am more interested in the pathway analysis app than the ontology one. Do you think it is worth applying to both? 12:11 <sdumitriu> So yes, email Asha for the Pathways project 12:11 <sdumitriu> Well, it depends 12:11 <ruthgrace_> I've emailed Asha and the CCM mentors email already. 12:11 <ruthgrace_> Do you know what my chances of getting the position are? 12:12 <ruthgrace_> I noticed that Sick Kids is only planning on taking 2-4 students. 12:12 <sdumitriu> The more projects you apply to, the better your chances of being selected for one of them 12:12 <sdumitriu> On the other hand, the more you spread out, the lower the quality of each application 12:12 <ruthgrace_> Thanks. Would trying to patch a small bug in MedSavant greatly increase my chances? 12:13 <sdumitriu> Yes 12:13 <ruthgrace_> And do you know how many students have contacted CCM regarding a Google Summer of Code project? 12:13 <sdumitriu> Hm, let me check 12:14 <sdumitriu> Around 40 that I know of 12:14 <ruthgrace_> Wow! Have any of them tried to patch anything in MedSavant? 12:14 <sdumitriu> Not yet 12:15 <ruthgrace_> Okay. I will try to be the first. Thank you very much! I appreciate it. 12:15 <sdumitriu> You're welcome 13:12 <SayAsh> has joined #ccm 17:09 <pritham> has joined #ccm 17:11 <pritham> Hi! 17:13 <sdumitriu> Hi pritham 17:15 <pritham> I was having a little trouble setting up the PhenoTips project on my computer. 17:15 <pritham> When I run "mvn install", I'm getting: [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:clirr-maven-plugin:2.5:check (c lirr-check) on project patient-data-api: There were 2 errors. -> [Help 1] org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal o rg.codehaus.mojo:clirr-maven-plugin:2.5:check (clirr-check) on project patient-d ata-api: There were 2 errors. 17:20 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 17:29 <sdumitriu> pritham: Did you make any changes, or is that the official code? 17:33 <pritham> Nope. No changes yet. That was the official code. 17:34 <sdumitriu> Hm, that error shouldn't be there... 17:34 <sdumitriu> Can you pastebin the whole log? 17:36 <pritham> Definitely. One moment. 17:45 <pritham> http://pastebin.com/gkEtyswa 17:51 <sdumitriu> Hm, weird, GitHub might have made a bad merge 18:05 <sdumitriu> pritham: What version of Maven are you using? 18:05 <sdumitriu> mvn -version 18:11 <pritham> has joined #ccm 18:12 <sdumitriu> pritham: What version of Maven are you using? 18:12 <sdumitriu> mvn -version 18:12 <pritham> 3.2.1 18:13 <sdumitriu> I've just committed a change that might fix it, but you should use Maven 3.0.x anyway, since other things will fail with a different version 18:22 <ruthgrace_> sdumitriu: should we be using Maven 3.0.x for MedSavant too? 18:22 <sdumitriu> No 18:22 <sdumitriu> That should work with newer versions 18:22 <ruthgrace_> Perfect! Thanks. 20:25 <ruthgrace> has joined #ccm 20:53 <ruthgrace> Hello, what is the best way to install the MedSavant client on linux mint? 20:53 <ruthgrace> I keep getting a null pointer exception 20:54 <sdumitriu> What did you try? 20:55 <ruthgrace> I mvn packaged the client and tried to run the .jar . I think I need the server, too, though 20:55 <ruthgrace> Is that correct? 20:55 <sdumitriu> It depends 20:55 <ruthgrace> I also tried packaging the installer and running that, with the same null pointer exception 20:55 <sdumitriu> You need _a_ server to connect to 20:56 <sdumitriu> So most likely you do need to have the server running locally 20:56 <ruthgrace> Okay. Thank you. 20:57 <sdumitriu> But when do you get the exception? 20:57 <sdumitriu> Do you get to the login screen, or is it before that? 20:57 <ruthgrace> Before that. 20:57 <ruthgrace> And when I click the option to report the error there is another error. 20:58 <ruthgrace> Should running the server be a simple matter of running mvn install in the MedSavantServerEngine directory and then running the resulting .jar? 21:00 <sdumitriu> Yes, except that you also need to install http://www.infobright.org/ and start it 21:00 <sdumitriu> Since that's the DB that MedSavant uses 21:00 <ruthgrace> Ah, thank you. 21:02 <sdumitriu> Well, if you don't get to the login screen, then something else is wrong 21:02 <sdumitriu> Can you pastebin the stack trace? 21:06 <ruthgrace> Sure. One second. 21:10 <ruthgrace> http://pastebin.com/HvHy9fWs 21:11 <ruthgrace> Right at the point where it says '5 more ..." I clicked Report in the null pointer exception dialog, and got another error. 21:13 <ruthgrace> So the first error says Error, null, cause: null pointer exception, and after I click Report Issue, the second error says Could not initialize class org.ut.biolab.medsavant.client.view.util.ViewUtil 21:13 <ruthgrace> and if I press Report Issue again, the second error reoccurs 21:13 <ruthgrace> I packaged it this type by typing 'mvn install' 21:14 <ruthgrace> in the MedSavantClient directory 21:15 <sdumitriu> Hm, that looks like a bug 21:15 <ruthgrace> I am running Maven 3.0.4, with Java version 1.7.0_25 21:15 <sdumitriu> Marc recently made some changes to the fonts 21:16 <ruthgrace> Should I try it on a windows machine instead? 21:16 <sdumitriu> No 21:16 <ruthgrace> Do you think that would make a difference? 21:16 <ruthgrace> Okay. 21:17 <ruthgrace> Is it correct that once the bug is fixed, I can run the client by installing ICE, running the MedSavantServerEngine .jar, and then running the MedSavantClient .jar ? 21:18 <sdumitriu> Yep, I got the same error 21:18 <sdumitriu> Yes, that is correct 21:18 <sdumitriu> You could prove your skills by fixing this bug 21:19 <ruthgrace> Haha, alright. How long will you be here for? 21:20 <ruthgrace> I will do my best. :) 21:21 <sdumitriu> I don't know, I'll be here for a while 21:21 <ruthgrace> Thanks again. I'm sure I will have more questions later. 21:32 <ruthgrace> Do you have an SMTP host, user name, password, etc. for the log4j appender? 21:33 <ruthgrace> When I run the MedSavantServerEngine .jar I get 21:33 <ruthgrace> log4j:ERROR Could not find value for key log4j.appender.EMAIL 21:33 <ruthgrace> log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate appender named "EMAIL". 21:34 <sdumitriu> That's another bug 21:35 <ruthgrace> OK, I just took out the line that was using the EMAIL. 21:58 <ruthgrace> What is the default directory at which MedSavant stores supporting files? 21:58 <sdumitriu> Server or client? 21:59 <ruthgrace> Server 21:59 <ruthgrace> Is it just in src/main/resources? 21:59 <ruthgrace> no, that can't be it - only the log4j.properties file is there 22:00 <sdumitriu> No, by default it stores in the current directory, but you can create a configuration file for it 22:01 <ruthgrace> so inside the target directory? 22:01 <sdumitriu> Yes 22:01 <ruthgrace> Okay. I think it's not initialized as anything. I'll find out in a bit. 22:02 <sdumitriu> See distribution/medsavant-server-zip/src/main/resources/medsavant.properties 22:02 <sdumitriu> You can copy that, change it, and use it with: 22:02 <sdumitriu> java -jar medsavant-server-1.2-SNAPSHOT.jar -c medsavant.properties 22:03 <ruthgrace> thanks! :) 22:44 <ruthgrace> Hi, dumb question. I'm having trouble getting ICE set up. I've followed the install instructions here: https://www.infobright.org/index.php/ICE_Wiki/wiki-4/installation/Install-Guide-for-Linux/ 22:44 <ruthgrace> when I try to run /etc/init.d/mysqld-ib start it says: 22:44 <ruthgrace> Error - /etc/my-ib.cnf was not found! Please make sure Infobright installation completed and activated successfully. 22:45 <ruthgrace> Would running /usr/local/infobright/postconfig.sh help? 22:45 <sdumitriu> Yes 22:46 <ruthgrace> Do you know what the default installation directory is? 22:46 <sdumitriu> But you must run it from the directory where that script is 22:47 <ruthgrace> Ah. Thanks. 22:52 <ruthgrace> Do you know why I am getting this error? 22:52 <ruthgrace> com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLNonTransientConnectionException: Could not create connection to database server. Attempted reconnect 3 times. Giving up. 22:53 <ruthgrace> (from running the MedSavantServerEngine .jar after sucessfully starting the ICE database) 22:53 <sdumitriu> Did you start the server? 22:53 <sdumitriu> Make sure it is indeed running, run mysql-ib 22:54 <ruthgrace> oh yes. that yields ERROR 2002 (HY000): Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/tmp/mysql-ib.sock' (2) 22:54 <ruthgrace> When I run /etc/init.d/mysqld-ib start 22:54 <ruthgrace> it says: 22:55 <ruthgrace> Starting MySQL ........ * 22:55 <ruthgrace> and the asterisk is red 22:55 <sdumitriu> So something failed 22:56 <ruthgrace> Is there some sort of log file? To tell me what failed? 22:56 <sdumitriu> Yes 22:56 <sdumitriu> Check in /etc/my-ib.cnf 22:56 <sdumitriu> There should be a log-error setting 22:58 <ruthgrace> the bh.err file that it points to seems to be empty 23:03 <ruthgrace> Should I uncomment the #general_log=1 and #general_log_file=path-of-datadir/general_query.log, in /etc/my-ib.cnf ? 23:06 <sdumitriu> No, that's about actual SQL queries 23:08 <ruthgrace> okay. 23:08 <ruthgrace> I am at a loss as to what to try next. Do you have any suggestions? 23:09 <sdumitriu> Did the postconfig script print any errors? 23:10 <ruthgrace> Nope. 23:11 <ruthgrace> it only printed this: 23:11 <ruthgrace> http://pastebin.com/br1WfH6R 23:12 <ruthgrace> (Infobright server activated) 23:13 <sdumitriu> Check what's in /var/log/messages 23:15 <ruthgrace> I don't seem to have messages in /var/log 23:15 <ruthgrace> there is an empty mysql.err 23:17 <ruthgrace> I just did sudo apt-get install mysql-server and sudo apt-get update, but they didn't help 23:17 <ruthgrace> (i didn't have mysql-server before) 23:22 <ruthgrace> I'm going to uncomment the lines recommended in post 2 of this thread: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1728570 23:22 <ruthgrace> apparently that's how I can get a /var/log/messages 23:27 <ruthgrace> hey, I have a /var/log/messages now 23:27 <sdumitriu> Try to start mysqld-ib again 23:28 <ruthgrace> it failed in the same way and all it says in my /var/log/messages is http://pastebin.com/hVyXJ4up 23:28 <ruthgrace> the bh.err is empty as before. 23:33 <ruthgrace> Any other suggestions? 23:42 <ruthgrace> Should I make a pull request for changing the log4j.properties line from log4j.logger.org.ut.biolab.medsavant.db.variants.update=DEBUG, EMAIL to log4j.logger.org.ut.biolab.medsavant.db.variants.update=DEBUG to prevent that EMAIL error? 23:43 <sdumitriu> I'm not sure 23:43 <sdumitriu> There used to be a definition for the EMAIL logger, but Marc removed it 23:43 <sdumitriu> Not sure why 23:43 <sdumitriu> You can make a pull request and ask for feedback 23:44 <ruthgrace> Sure 23:44 <ruthgrace> Should I try to find someone at infobright to help me get the database server working? 23:48 <sdumitriu> Yep 23:52 <ruthgrace> Is this the right place to do that: https://www.infobright.org/forums/sendmessage.php 23:52 <sdumitriu> Yes
